etymology.description: 教(教) (jiào, "teach") and 导(導) (dǎo, "guide") together form the compound 教导(教導) (jiàodǎo, "instruct; teach"). The word conveys the notion of not only imparting knowledge but also guiding and mentoring someone.
etymology.interpretation: The combination makes sense as it encompasses both teaching and guiding, suggesting a comprehensive approach to education that includes mentorship and leadership.

examples.chinese: 老师教导学生(老師教導學生)。
父母教导孩子(父母教導孩子)，要做正直的人(要做正直的人)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ jiàodǎo háizi, yào zuò zhèngzhí de rén.
examples.english: Parents instruct their children to be honest people.
